column1: Kamensk-Shakhtinsky (Russian: Ка́менск-Ша́хтинский) is a town in Rostov Oblast
column2: located on the Seversky Donets River. Population: 95

column1: It was founded by Cossack settlers in 1686 and was granted town status in 1927.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as Kamensk-Shakhtinsky Urban Okrug—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: this administrative unit also has urban okrug status.

column1: Once a major coal-mining center of the eastern Donets coal basin
column2: it now an important producer of artificial fibers and mining machinery as well as glass. European route E40 passes through Kamensk-Shakhtinsky.
